New Records: Aaron Johnson scored a 44-ball 52, his sixth T20I fifty off 39 balls
Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 7 wickets (with 15 balls remaining)
Aaron Johnson smashed the first two balls of the innings for boundaries
Mohammad Amir sent Navneet Dhaliwal's middle stump flying with a searing in-dipper
Nicholas Kirton was run out by a direct throw from Imad Wasim
Haris Rauf struck twice in three balls to claim his 100th T20I wicket
Pre-Game Insights: Babar won the toss and had no hesitation in fielding first
Pakistan's fast bowlers were expected to set up the win
Post-Match Reflections: Rizwan took Pakistan to their first win after Amir-led quicks put on a big show
The win was set up by the fast bowlers, who combined to pick up six wickets
Rizwan stayed put, crafting an unbeaten run-a-ball 53 to give Pakistan victory 15 balls to spare
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada faced 76 dot balls, the most in an innings at the men's T20 World Cup
31 of the 36 deliveries from Canada in the powerplay were on a length or short of a length
Pakistan's win did not lift their NRR above that of USA
